review.title: Hotel is in  a good location
review.reviewText: Rooms need remodeling ,carpet was not clean ,no alarm clock
review.locationRemarks: Not to far from San Francisco

review.title: Not worth the stay. Ghetto area.
review.reviewText: Complementary breakfast is just cheap coffee and cheap pastries. Not enough pillows or towels. Staff were friendly but the hotel entirely needs to step up their statements.

review.title: The room smell  bad
review.reviewText: The room smells bad we told the front desk they came with a bottle of something but the bottle was broken

review.title: Right off freeway
review.reviewText: Stayed two nights. Shared a room with another couple. The hotel was clean but it was old. The bathroom didn't have a fan and the door didn't shut all the way so you couldn't lock it. Convenient location north of Oakland right off the freeway. Just needed a cheap but clean place to stay near San Francisco (about a 20 min drive without traffic, 45 mins with traffic).

review.title: Asked to wait 15 mins bc expedia res not in system
review.reviewText: i made an expedia reservation and went to the hotel about 10 minutes later.  the person at reception said it was not in his system.  he asked me to wait 10 to 15 minutes. i came back.  at first, he had said there were no king beds (my reservation) but i was given a king when i finally checked in. fine room.  kind of shady area, next to highway.  looked ok but was not very solid looking. bit older inside etc.  but TV and internet worked.  shampoo and soap provided. one of cheaper hotels in area but not super cheap.
review.positiveRemarks: price, location, clean enough, tv etc worked.

review.reviewText: Not the kind of hotel I am used to staying at.  But it was ok for a few days.

review.title: Cheap for California - you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: As I have read in other posts, the hotel is not in the best part of town hence the cheap prices.  You may have a certain level of anxiety staying there.  In order to increase security, though, they have installed many, bright security lights.  You should expect to see many people there with various backgrounds.  The walls in the room are painted in a stucco fashion.  The carpet in my room has seen better days.  The bathroom was ok except for the placement of the bathroom tissue holder (very inconvenient).  The cleaning staff made the bed but afterward did not want to replace the thin, decorative bed accent at the foot of the bed.  Also, they changed the towels but were regularly reluctant to empty the trash or vacuum the floors as necessary.  I did, however, see someone spot check some of the rooms.  Moreover, as in other posts, I smelled cigarette and other smoke that came into my room although all windows and doors were closed.  So, while you may have asked for a non-smoking room, you may come into contact with it anyway.  Additionally, I had to request an ironing board but received a small ironing board that lays on the bed.  You should, moreover, expect to pay the full costs of your stay at the time of check-in.  I will say that the hotel office staff were very helpful.  The upside of the hotel is knowing that they are currently renovating/modernizing the rooms and exterior.  Check back with them in a year or eighteen months and perhaps the accommodations will be better.
review.positiveRemarks: Since it was in a suburb of a major city, the price was low in comparison to costs in the city or near main attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel recognizes the need to modernize and is undertaking steps to improve the facility.
review.locationRemarks: In San Francisco, boat rides, Alcatraz, aquarium, Madame Tussauds, Ripley's believe it or not, The Dungeons, Chinatown, Exploratorium, street cars.

review.title: Vday get away
review.reviewText: It was a nice stay clean rooms lost of parking. But don't understand why they don't have more towels and the area it's in A 50$ deposit should not be added to $90 and 109.90$ cheap looking rooms..

review.title: run
review.reviewText: mold in shower, room smelled of something(?) continental breakfast was a cup of luke warm coffee, with packaged sugar and cream and a packaged pastry.  had to go to the office two times before there was coffee available.

review.title: Awesome service ðŸ™†
review.reviewText: Love it would have love it more if there was a fridge and microwave but it don't matter it was just grate

review.title: Poor. won't stay there EVER
review.reviewText: I made a quick reservation - expedia said the hotel was within 3 miles of the venue I was planning on going that night. Turns out it was more like 8 - 10 miles which sucked because of the cab fare - I wanted a hotel within 5 mile radius - Thanks for the lie Expedia. Anyways I wasn't planning on staying in a hotel, but I decided I needed one last minute. I checked in after 3PM and go to find my room - the door was wide open... Do I go in? or wait? I went in because I needed to start getting ready. I had no towels and there were oreos left in the freezer?!?! What in the heck. Honestly, I went to bed hoping that I was sleeping in clean sheets - I probably should have just slept in my car. The area was sketchy and the hotel service was terrible. at least it had free wifi because my service was terrible on my phone. I am glad I had my best friend to share this adventure with though. Wouldn't recommend for the faint at heart.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, prompt check in times, rooms prepared and ready for the guest, accommodating staff
review.locationRemarks: Terrible - scary. stay out of that area.

review.title: Good value, easy location
review.reviewText: Everything was clean and comfortable. Bed very comfortable. Even had a nice size refrigerator and microwave, and best of all a regular coffee maker (not one of those lousy little one-cup things)! Higher than 2 stars, I think - more like a 3-star place!

review.title: Cheap.
review.reviewText: Very cheap both quality and financially cheap. Walls are thin was able to hear my neighbor. TV was not a flat screen. No fridge unless it's a king room. Door lock was not screwed in all the way. The shower head was incorrect. Couldn't get it in the middle it was either way too cold or way too hot. I would turn it to cold but it was actually hot. Room was just cheap. If you don't care about the quality of the room then stay here, it's inexpensive.

review.title: Clean Hotel/Moderate price
review.reviewText: I was nicely surprised by the customer service provided by the front desk person Ganga. Always ready to help you to make your stay more comfortable. He is a service oriented person. We need more like him working at the hotels!
review.locationRemarks: I didnt think it was a great location not many options to eat, walk to the Bart, etc. You have to have a car!

review.title: My hotel room was clean, spacious, and neat.
review.reviewText: My trip included one night only at this hotel, so my experience is very limited. Still, for those who are travelling to the East bay Area (Richmond, Berkeley, etc.), this hotel is a good option.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was spacious, need and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Have more visible outlets or power strips to charge my computer, phone, and wi-fi device (I always bring my own).
review.locationRemarks: The location is not good if you want to do business or sightseeing in San Francisco.

review.reviewText: We were a little worried since it does not look good from the outside. Once there the staff was very friendly and the check in quick. Our room was a big surprise since it was newly made. Clean bathroom and toilet and nice beds. There is a fridge and microwave also a Tv. There are a lot of workers, and they were on the weekends pretty loud at night. The motel is off the freeway, but it was not too loud.
The hitel was under construction, a little bit  noisy, maybe it will be better after the renovation.

review.title: The room smells bad , bathroom is not clean
review.reviewText: It is supposed to be a non-smoking room, but it smells very bad, the wall paint is coming off. The room is very small, bathroom is not clean

review.title: Just a cheap place to crash for the night
review.reviewText: The hotel was old, had mold, and was next to a very busy freeway so could hear traffic noise all night (I'm a light sleeper) so if you're a light sleeper, I would not recommend this place. The walls were pretty thin so we could hear the occupants in the next door.
Very dirty holesin the wall / no TV service , overall very dirty ugly area .

review.title: Convenient for BART access!
review.reviewText: Aside from the closeness to the BART station (30 min. walk according to front desk staff, or one exit away driving) - there is not a whole lot more that is 'good'. Upon arrival we found the parking lot full of old furniture, mattresses etc.which made us wonder if the 'hotel' was even open! It was. Room on second level offered two beds as booked, a wobbly fridge, a coffee maker, a shower with 'either' cold or hot water (no mix available!) and a door frame through which daylight was visible. No food service of any kind close by, except back at the BART station (El Cerrito North).

managementResponses.response:
thank for taking the time to say a few words about our Hotel, Yes we are now into exterior renovation.

GM 
Americas best value Inn 
Richmond/San Francisco

review.title: Surprisingly nice stay!
review.reviewText:
The outside appearance of this motel was not very appealing at all. We were kind of scared to stay, however when speaking to the manager, he assured us that we were in a good area. But, as we moved in to our room, we were happily surprised!  The room was clean, the bed were so comfortable, and it smelled very nice. We slept very good on the mattresses; the bathroom was clean and updated. We were very happy with our room. 

We plan to use this motel again when we are back in the area. As the renovations are completed, we're hoping that the outer appearance catches up to the inside.

Thanks!
review.positiveRemarks: The mattress and pillows were super comfortable!  We also liked the cleanliness of the room. The window was very quaint.
review.negativeRemarks: The exterior could be cleaned up and manicured. It was not very eye appealing.
review.locationRemarks: In driving the area, San Pablo took us to Berkeley and downtown Oakland. We had a great time!

review.reviewText: These people are horrible they took $95 out of our card and we didn't even stay at their hotel

Staff were very nice but hotel is in a very ghetto area. Other people at hotel were very loud outside couldn't go to sleep until  3am when I called the front desk to ask them if they could talk to them and they did. Room was small found trash under bed. Overall not the best hotel but very good staff thank you for all your help.

review.title: Run down but convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the freeway so there's easy access to Berkeley (which is 10 minutes south). The area of town is marginal, and the motel is very dated. But the bed was comfortable. The sink is outside the toilet/shower room, a short distance away, and is very small. I won't go back, even though the price is one of the best in the Berkeley area.
review.negativeRemarks: The room is dark and feels dingy.
review.locationRemarks: Location is in a marginal part of town. There's big signs in the parking area about how the hotel is not responsible for any thefts.

review.title: Crowded and uncomfortable.
review.reviewText:
It was too close to the traffic, and we had to open the window to air out the smell of smoke--even though it was a NON smoking room--no luggage racks, sink right as you walk in the door, no counter space for persona items next to sink, paint peeling from doors and walls, dingy stairs, and crowded floor space.

Beds were comfortable and clean. TV worked fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Add luggage racks, move out some of the furniture: it took up too much space. Paint the bathroom.

review.title: Best Value?!
review.reviewText: Noisy. Building caught next to a busy arterial, nearly under a freeway. Staff wouldn't tell husband or friend who tried to phone me if I was there or whether I had checked out. Took their messages but never delivered them. Staff was pleasant to me. No reading lamp. Minimal TV station access, about 6 loser stations. Not near restaurants but handy for getting back on the freeway. Didn't tell me there would be coffee for breakfast, so I checked out before I knew that. No fire/smoke detector in room but the wires hung from the ceiling where it should have been. Nothing of interest to do or see nearby. No maps of the city available.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was pleasant to me and tried to be helpful re restaurants locations. Getting out of town and onto freeway in the morning was fast and easy.
review.negativeRemarks: Better information beforehand  about the location of busy streets,  restaurants, city center, convenient routes to places of importance/interest.
review.locationRemarks: See above for location. It was easy driving distance to the convention I was there to attend.

review.reviewText: Near UCBerkeley, it was clean, internet OK and free and free parking. In general I would recommend it

review.title: Wouldn't recommend
review.reviewText: Booked non smoking room and got smoking room.   Didn't have any non smoking rooms available

review.title: Don't be fooled by the pic on the internet!
review.reviewText:
We rented two rooms and the a/c didn't work in either. I cannot sleep hot and I have to have moving air, whether its from wind, a fan, or a/c. So I figured ok, we'll just open the window, its cooler at night, we are in the bay area, and i'll leave the a/c on and just let the fan move the air. It didn't cool down after a couple hours so I called the front desk and asked for a fan. He said ok, he would go find one.  Oh, by the way, while I was on the phone with him, a cockroach was walking on the wall about a foot from my head and I started freaking out saying there's cockroaches in here! He didn't say ANYTHING! Then, my friend tells me there is an earwig crawling around in the picture on the wall.
 
So we never heard back from him. Called him again about an hour later. He said he is not allowed to leave the desk. ok? Couldn't you have called us? I asked if he had a fan for me that we could go to the front desk and get? He said yes. So my husband goes to the front desk, oh, this is a heater. Are you freakin kidding me?

So we slept with the window open part of the night but the hotel is on a pretty busy street so loud vehicles kept waking us up. Not to mention I could feel every spring in the cheap mattress. Then, in the middle of the night the fan started making this super loud horrible grinding noise. So that was nice to get scared awake to.
review.positiveRemarks: I did like the shower. Out dated, but the pressure and heat was good. My back needed it baaad after sleeping on that bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The service, a/c, bugs, beds, and better windows that lock out more sound
review.locationRemarks: The location is ghetto. Be sure to lock your car and take all valuables out.

review.title: Terrible hotel!
review.reviewText: Very uncomfortable and poor condition hotel. My two sons got bitten by bed bugs!!! Free breakfst was only a box of donuts and very bad quility coffee. Not recommend this hotel!!!

review.title: The whole place needs repairs
review.reviewText:
The whole place needs repairs, everything is falling apart, smell really bad for a non smoking. Carpet needs to be replaced or at least shampoo more often (if any)...
The location is good, not too far from Sausalito or San Francisco, really close to fwy, has free parking (These are all the plus)
review.positiveRemarks: location, they changed bed sheets/ towels daily, free and huge parking, very close to fwy and close to cerritos plaza w/lots stores and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: If I were a manager I would repaint all rooms, change carpet to ceramic or to new carpet, change tubs and toilets, faucets, beds and bed covers

review.title: Nice hotel for price!
review.reviewText: I wasn't sure about this place because of the previous ratings, but the price was right for me, so I gave it a try. I was very pleased! Everything was clean, no bed bugs, air conditioner worked, and it was quiet. I'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: very bad customer service
review.reviewText:
in terms of customer service the hotel staff can gain ZERO. I ordered some purchases online and it was received and singed by one of the staff. amazingly when i asked for the items the staff advised that they through it into garbage !!!

several iterations of debates with no result. they even threatened me to crash my cat if i kept parking it in the garage.

when i am receiving a call on the hotel line the staff claiming that my line is busy !!!
review.negativeRemarks: change all the staff and management. i did an escalation to the American Best management with no feedback till now

review.title: Not the  best.
review.reviewText: The parking lot was small. The ice machine was broken. The housekeeper just opened our door without knocking. She did bring us more towels. Lighting wasn't the best. The water in the shower was cold while it stayed very warm in the sink. This hotel definitely needs to be upgraded and major attention would be helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Affordability. The room wasn't bad for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: No window should be in this bathroom, especially when you look out of it and see a freeway. Yikes!
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway. But in a bad part of town.

review.title: Bad Motel
review.reviewText: My bed had terrible curvature of the spine which it tried to transmit to me. Heavy smokers all around. Smoking in their rooms as I passed by and in the doorways. ALL rooms are supposed to be non-smoking in California. The noise level was unbelievably high.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and start anew.

review.title: Best hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean ..i love it san francisco one of the best hotel to stay in i will recomend it

review.title: Shockingly good. Expected the worst and got a grea
review.reviewText: t stay. Got the room earlier. Other then iron for my cloths had ething.

review.title: San Francisco stop
review.reviewText: Not at all what we expected. The hotel had cars with graffiti in the parking lot. The hotel room window was less than 30 feet from a highway. The toilet took at least 3 flushes to go down each time. When we checked out - we waited about 10 mins and no one came to the desk window. We just slid our key under the glass. There were crumbs on the carpet in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: had a fridge. The sheets appeared clean.
review.negativeRemarks: clean up the parking lot. have someone at the desk "window"
review.locationRemarks: We stayed here to be close to San Francisco - but also along the route to Napa

review.title: The price is reasonable.
review.reviewText:
It is OK for just sleep.
The bed is clean and comfortable for me. The bathroom is clean.

review.title: Power outage every 5 minutes
review.reviewText: While using the blow dryer and heating up water in the microwave, there is sure to be an outage. The staff advised us to only keep one light on, and to stop using the microwave and blow dryer at the same time. Sounded reasonable. However, after turning off ALL lights in the room, unplugging the blow dryer, the microwave set to 30 seconds to heat up water, there'd still be an outage. Very disappointing.

review.title: Great bed, poor shower
review.reviewText: King size bed was very comfortable. The desk said they were ln the process of changing to new shower heads with multi settings and that ours may be an old one. I politely let them know that this was a multi setting head and that the sink had plenty of water pressure. Therefore the orifice in the shower head was to small becauze I had experienced this in a shower head that I recently replaced.
review.locationRemarks: Dining, retail stores, and Shasta Lake Dam about 30 minutes North.

review.title: Cheap but needs work
review.reviewText: Rooms were not very clean and everything needed updating.
review.locationRemarks: Close to highway for access to Bay Bridge and San Francisco

review.title: Great for a stopover. Leaving Bay Area.
review.reviewText: Great for a stopover. Used for 1 night leaving Bay Area to explore Redwood coast to Northern Cal. Wifi great, room comfortable. Neded for 1 night was ok. Staff was nice. Next to busy road but was quiet inside room.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms conducive with aging hotel that charges lower rates.
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway but quiet, easy to find with GPS. Good hotel to use before heading into Bay Area whether into SFO or heading north to Redwood or Wine

review.title: A little sketchy...
review.reviewText: Definitely lock your car here; expect for other guests to ask for handouts. That sorta thing.
review.positiveRemarks: Cheap? AC worked, cable tv. The staff was great, but that's about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete tear down and rebuild for a more current and less dated design.
review.locationRemarks: Visited on business, so nothing to add here.

review.title: Great rooms, though the building looks old outside
review.reviewText:
Excellent rooms, really clean and new! The building looks old from outside but the rooms are recently renovated, nice big HD tv, great beds and clean bathrooms. Wifi works well, even for facetime/Skype. Rooms even have mini fridges and microwaves!
Great deal. And the guy at the front was very nice, even reduced the price when we decided to stay another night.

review.title: Affordable East Bay Hotel Option
review.reviewText: Very convenient location off the 80 Freeway, nice staff, comfortable beds, great option!

review.title: Good enough for an overnight stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok. Good nights stay. The area is a little sketchy but overall I would stay there again for an overnight stay.

review.title: Definitely recommended as good budget accomodation
review.reviewText:
Good sized room, comfortable bed, acceptable shower. Everything worked well and was clean. A less than salubrious part of town but we had no concerns about safety and security. Right beside the freeway on and off ramps, so easy to find and access.
Reception staff disinterested and colourless, the breakfast an almost non-event but still, this place is great value for money and definitely recommended.

review.title: Comfortable!
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy, but a good room with the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in!

review.title: Good bang for the buck
review.reviewText: Just off of the highway, very convenient to go to San Francisco without having to pay expensive hotels over there.

review.title: Nice roon and great service
review.reviewText: This is hotel is right by the freeway but it's not too loud. Room is not very big but tidy and clean. The service is awesome. When we checked in, we asked about the laundry mat close by and the owner offered us free laundry service. And he called us after a little while to see if we actually need the service. We left for dinner. When we came back, the laundry was already done and folded in the hotel room.

review.title: Amazing
review.reviewText: I felt welcomed and my friends and I enjoyed our time there.

review.title: â€œVery Impressedâ€
review.reviewText: This hotel is good value for the money. It is clean, and has what I need in a hotel: security, convenience (right off the freeway), free parking, free wireless, breakfast (basic cereal, pastry.), and a great price. The room was reasonably large, the bed comfortable, and great pillows. It was quiet, and there was coffee in the room. This is not the place to go for a luxury experience, but I was there for a night visiting family, and it was perfect place to stay.

review.title: dump
review.reviewText: Bad location, homeless characters, odor of humidity in room, poor maintenance.

review.title: I will not go back ever.
review.reviewText: It is a very cheap hotel. It is not worth spending a penny on it.

review.title: Cost does not fit what you get. Not even for the Bay Area.
review.reviewText: Inn was just below a busy freeway. Could hear the traffic during the early evening hours and early morning. Bathroom sink basin was not in the bathroom. Was just inside the front door next to the clothes closet. There were no bathroom ammenties, only soap. The bathroom window which opened to the outside walkway would not locked. Had to put a clothes hanger so window could not slide open.

review.title: Decent hotel for overnight stay
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 1 night after a concert in San Fran. Great location right off freeway. Would stay here again. Neighborhood looks like it could be a little scetchy at night, but I had no issues.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 9 nights at the beginning and the end of our stay and it is a good value. The rooms are clean and right sized. There is free wireless internet, fridge and microwave in the rooms. The bad points are the sketchy neighborhood (but nothing to make you unsafe inside your room), they forgot to clean our room one day, the breakfast is only coffee and snacks (the snacks if you're lucky), the highway is very close then it's very noisy all night long (if you're a light sleeper this hotel is not for you.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our night at this hotel. The room was clean and the staff very friendly. The hotel is in a nice part of Richmond, on the border to Albany, and we felt safe there at night.

review.title: Small but Cozy
review.reviewText: The room was small but perfect for just two. We were only there a night we had been all around San Francisco and were glad when we got to our room that it was clean and able to get a good night sleep. Would stay again in this hotel. Liked the instant access to the freeway and the fact it was right exiting the freeway was a plus for us.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel without a lot of frills, but it was clean and safe. The beds were in good repair and there were a lot of options for food delivery nearby. I would recommend it for value-conscious travelers who want to stay somewhere convenient to Richmond/Oakland without paying a great deal. The room we booked was supposed to be a Deluxe suite with jacuzzi but when we arrived was a regular room with a standard bath. Even with that, it was a good stay.

review.title: tiny rooms - not in the best neighborhood
review.reviewText: clean, but very old units. For an overnighter, would be comfortable enough.
